info.title: WorkersComp
info.description: Workers Compensation API Methods used for client integrations.

post.description: This endpoint allows the user to authenticate using their username / password, and will return token that can be plugged into other API methods.
Submits a bill to Renovo's Backend Service, Prime Conductor.  This request will either starts or resumes a bill processing workflow.
Loads a provider to a client profile in Renovo.  Provider loaded through this process are returned as the Pay-To provider in a GetBill operation.
Loads a workers comp claim to Renovo

requestBody.description: Create a claim in Renovo through /LoadClaim method

post.description: Add payment to a bill in Renovo

get.description: This endpoint allows you to fetch a bill.  A call to a webhook will provide the specific identifiers that can be used to retrieve the bill details in this request.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The Authorization Header for the Request

get.description: This endpoint is used to pick up EORs and other PDF documents associated with the bill

ClaimId.description: The Claim Id associated with the bill

ClientId.description: The Client Id associated with the bill

ClientClaimId.description: The Client's Claim Number.  This is generally as the identifier for the incoming claim, and would show up on the EOR.

Product.description: Prime's product code. W for Worker's Comp

AdjusterEmail.description: Adjuster's email address is used to link a bill to the adjuster's Renovo account.The Client Identifier

ApportionedPercentage.description: Percentag eof responsibility client owes on the claim

SSN.description: Patient Social Security Number or Green Card Number

NAIC.description: Payer/Insurer NAIC Code. Required for NCCI Reporting

BodyPartId.description:
+ 10 - Multiple Head Injury - Any Combination of Below Parts
+ 12 - Brain
+ 13 - Ear(s) - Includes: Hearing, Inside Eardrum
+ 14 - Eye(s) - Includes: Optic Nerves, Vision, Eye Lids
+ 15 - Nose - Includes: Nasal Passage, Sinus, Sense of Smell
+ 16 - Teeth
+ 17 - Mouth - Includes: Lips, Tongue, Throat, Taste
+ 18 - Soft Tissue
+ 19 - Facial Bones - Includes: Jaw
+ Neck
+ 20 - Multiple Neck Injuries - Any Combination of Below Parts
+ 21 - Vertebrae - Includes: Spinal Column Bone, Cervical Segment
+ 22 - Disc - Includes: Spinal Column Cartilage, Cervical Segment
+ 23 - Spinal Cord - Includes: Nerve Tissue, Cervical Segment
+ 24 - Larynx - Includes: Cartilage and Vocal Cords
+ 25 - Soft Tissue - Other than Larynx or Trachea
+ 26 - Trachea
+ 30 - Multiple Upper Extremities - Any Combination of Below Parts, Excluding Hands and Wrists Combined
+ 31 - Upper Arm - Humerus and Corresponding Muscles, Excluding Clavicle and Scapula
+ 32 - Elbow - Radial Head
+ 33 - Lower Arm - Fore Arm - Radius, Ulna and Corresponding Muscles
+ 35 - Hand - Metacarpals and Corresponding Muscles - Excluding Wrist or Fingers
+ 36 - Finger(s) - Other than the Thumb and Corresponding Muscles
+ 37 - Thumb
+ 38 - Shoulder(s) - Armpit, Rotator Cuff, Trapezius, Clavicle, Scapula
+ 39 - Wrist(s) & Hand(s)
+ 40 - Multiple Trunk - Any Combination of Below Parts
+ 41 - Upper Back Area - (Thoracic Area) Upper Back Muscles, Excluding Vertebrae, Disc, Spinal Cord
+ 42 - Lower Back Area - (Lumbar Area and Lumbo Sacral) Lower Back Muscles, Excluding Sacrum, Coccyx, Pelvis, Vertebrae, Disc, Spinal Cord
+ 43 - Disc - Spinal Column Cartilage other than Cervical Segment
+ 44 - Chest - Including Ribs, Sternum, Soft Tissue
+ 45 - Sacrum and Coccyx - Final Nine Vertebrae-fused
+ 46 - Pelvis
+ 47 - Spinal Cord - Nerve Tissue other than Cervical Segment
+ 48 - Internal Organs - Other than Heart and Lungs
+ 49 - Heart
+ 60 - Lungs
+ 61 - Abdomen Including Groin - Excluding Injury to Internal Organs
+ 62 - Buttocks - Soft Tissue
+ 63 - Lumbar & or Sacral Vertebrae (Vertebra NOC Trunk) - Bone Portion of the Spinal Column Lower Extremities
+ 50 - Multiple Lower Extremities - Any Combination of Below Parts
+ 51 - Hip
+ 52 - Upper Leg - Femur and Corresponding Muscles
+ 53 - Knee - Patella
+ 54 - Lower Leg - Tibia, Fibula and Corresponding Muscles
+ 55 - Ankle - Tarsals
+ 56 - Foot - Metatarsals, Heel, Achilles Tendon and Corresponding Muscles - Excluding Ankle or Toes
+ 57 - Toes
+ 58 - Great Toe
+ 64 - Artificial Appliance - Braces, Etc.
+ 65 - Insufficient Information to Properly Identify - Unclassified - Insufficient Information to Identify Part Affected
+ 66 - No Physical Injury - Mental Disorder
+ 90 - Multiple Body Parts (including Body Systems & Body Parts) - Applies When More than one major body part has been affected, such as an Arm and a Leg and Multiple Internal Organs.
+ 91 - Body Systems and Multiple Body Systems - Applies to the functioning of an entire body system that has been affected without specific injury to any other part, as in the case of Poisoning, Corrosive Action, Inflammation affecting Internal Organs

Side.description:
+ R = Right
+ L = Left
+ B = Bilateral
+ M = Multiple

TaxID.description: Provider Tax ID. Federal taxpayer identification number

NPI.description: National Provider Identifier. Unique 10-digit identification number provided by the federal government

ID.description: The unique identifier for the bill

BillTimes.description: Used to describe billable time applied towards a bill

jurisdictionState.description: The jurisdiction applied to the transaction

completionDate.description: The date/timestamp that the bill completed the workflow.

entityTypeQualifier.description: Describes the type of entity.  1 = Person, 2 = Non-Person

organizationName.description: The employer or policy subscriber name

address.description: The employer or policy subscriber address

address2.description: The employer or policy subscriber address (line 2)

city.description: The employer or policy subscriber city

state.description: The employer or policy subscriber state

zip.description: The employer or policy subscriber zip

county.description: The employer or policy subscriber county

organizationName.description: The carrier / payer of the claim

qualifier.description: X12 Qualifiers | 2U = Payer Id | EI = EIN | FY = Claim Office Number | NF = NAIC Code | G2 = Commercial Number | LU = Location Number

referenceValue.description: The value for the provided qualifier

payerResponsibilitySequence.description: P = Primary | S = Secondary | T = Tertiary

claimFilingIndicator.description: Subscriber Claim Filing Indicator X12 SBR09

qualifier.description: X12 Qualifiers | Y4 = Claim Number | SY = SSN

referenceValue.description: The value for the provided qualifier

contactType.description: X12 Values | TE = Phone | EM = Email

contactValue.description: The contact value for the provided qualifier

middleName.description: The patient middle name or initial

referenceValue.description: The value for the providied qualifier

contactType.description: Patient Contact Type (EM = Email | TE = Phone)

contactValue.description: Contact Value for the provided qualifier

productOrServiceQualifier.description: Product or Service ID Qualifier | HC = HCPCS | ER = Jurisdiction Specific Procedure and Supply Code

unitQualifier.description: Unit of Service Qualifier | UN = Units | MJ = Minutes

reasonCode.description: Adjustment Reason Code (CARC, RARC, ANSI, Custom)

adjustments.description: Line Item Adjustment.  This should balance with the current allowed (charge - adjustments = allowed)

formType.description: Form Type [HCFA, UBxx, UB04, UB92, DENT, PHAR, DME]

internalBillId.description: Used to track multiple transactions to a single bill.

reviewOnly.description: Indicates this is a Review Only transaction.

bypassPPO.description: Bypasses PPO from running during workflow execution.

loggingOnly.description: No Services Applied, the transaction is only logged.

testMode.description: Indicates the transaction is intended for testing purposes only.

workflowId.description: The workflow to apply.  The default workflow will apply when this is not supplied.

clientIdentifier.description: The client identifier, established during implementation.

parentIdentifier.description: The client identifier, established during implementation.

stateReportingRequired.description: This is a pass through so PRIME's state reporting service does not apply

AmountPaid.description: Amount of check in a decimal format

UpdateExistingPayment.description: If this payment transaction updates an existing payment transactionClient's Bill IDCliente's alllternaittive Bill IDPPriemes''s Client ID
